item.title: Learning about SSH
item.description: What is SSH? SSH Stands for: Secure Shell. 💻 It´s a network communication protocol designed by Tatu Ylonen in 1995. It works between client and server allowing secure transfers. It is normally used in “logins” and to perform operations in remote computers or to transfer data. 🧑🏻‍💻 SSH operates as a layered protocol comprising three principal hierachical components. Transport layer. 🚌 Provides server authentication, confidentiality and integrity. User Authentication Protocol. 🧑🏻‍💻 Validates user to server.
